thread.title: Tennessee baseball starts season with 8-5 win
thread.title_full: Tennessee baseball starts season with 8-5 win

title: Tennessee baseball starts season with 8-5 win
text:
Tennessee baseball starts season with 8-5 win Moberg, Santiago, Rodgers combine for six RBI, five runs scored while Martin gets the win. Slot to Tennessee Links (Photo: Tennessee Athletics, UTSports.com) 
The Tennessee baseball team started its season with an 8-5 win over Memphis on Friday at FedEx Park in Memphis. 
Hunter Martin started and pitched five innings, giving up three earned runs and the Tennessee bats gave him more than enough support with a five-run fourth inning to turn a 2-1 game into a six-run lead for the Vols. 
(Want the latest scoop on Tennessee football and basketball? Make sure you're in the loop â€” take five seconds to sign up for our FREE Vols newsletter now!) 
Jeff Moberg, Benito Santiago and Jordan Rodgers had two RBI each and combined to score five of the eight runs for Tennessee (1-0). 
Freshman Garrett Stallings pitched the final two innings, giving up an earned run on two hits. Martin struck out six, facing 22 batters before giving way to reliever Daniel Vasquez. 
First pitch between the Tigers and Vols on Saturday is scheduled for 3 p.m. The series will wrap with a 2 p.m. game Sunday.
